chapter.title: The Module System
chapter.para: Modules provide an additional level of scoping control, allowing symbolic and syntactic bindings to be bundled in a named or anonymous package. The package can then be imported into any scope, making the bindings contained in the module visible in only that scope.

&SISC;'s modules are provided by the portable syntax-case macro expander by R. Kent Dybvig and Oscar Waddell. A comprehensive explanation of the provided module system is best found in the
Chez Scheme Users Guide , specifically
Section 9.3, Modules .
